Dating: CHRISTIAN PERIOD (not before); CHRISTIAN PERIOD; ISLAMIC PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED; ENGOBE
Name: Jug
Description: Fragment of a large-sized jug with a wide mouth, a rounded rim with almost straight lip and a straight-walled body. Orangey-coloured paste and surface with a coating of the same colour. The exterior surface presents a painted decoration in dark red. On the lip geometrical designs (schematic palmettes) can be observed and on the body vegetal (schematic palmettes) and zoomorphic (fish) motifs, distributed over metopae which are separated by vertical lines demarcated by a vertical band in red.
